Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: C. C. Holland
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by some of the negative reviews on this product, and wondering if the folks who had problems somehow landed with defective models. My experience has been pretty flawless from day one. I bought this camera as an add-on to my usual DSLR; I was looking for a pocket-sized camera with a great zoom (this one had markedly better range than other pocket cameras I tested) and a nice variety of auto, semi-auto, and manual features to play with.One of the features some of the reviews took exception to was the push-button flash. I can understand the concern about breakage, but I've used this little guy for over 5 months now in less-than-delicate conditions and haven't had an issue. I actually like the manual nature of the flash, as it's an easy way to get a "flash" photo -- or turn off the flash -- without fiddling with the settings menu.It's been very good with rapid response in turning on/off, the menus are relatively intuitive, and some of the menu options -- such as the panorama setting -- are outstanding. I've taken some of the most beautiful landscape shots with this tiny camera, many of which rival even those taken with my Canon.Is there some noise? Yes. I also have noticed that in automatic settings, outdoor pictures tend to be a bit blown out and overexposed. I deal with that either in Photoshop/Lightroom, or by switching to a manual setting and adjusting ISO from there.The other little quibble I have it that when the zoom is maxed out, autofocus doesn't work. You have to pull back slightly on the zoom to activate the autofocus. Other than that, I haven't experienced the loss of focus or the problem with tracking focus that another reviewer mentioned.Is it perfect? No. But for the price, it's a great little camera for travel or for everyday shutterbug adventures when a big DSLR is too much to pack along. I'd definitely recommend this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Major Video Issues - Otherwise Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Sam Bravern
Reviews.Content: 4-stars for camera design and still image quality, 1 star for video.I have tested and compared images, video, features, and usability for all the top ultra-zoom compacts including Fuji F770EXR/F750EXR, Canon SX260HS, Sony HX9V, Panasonic ZS-15 and ZS-19/20.  This was the last camera I compared and I was expecting to really like it as Image Quality is my first priority criteria, followed by video, then features/usability.  Here's my main takeaways:- Well lit, ISO 100-200 shots: Fuji gets 3rd place.  Canon SX260HS has best detail with least noise.  Panasonic ZS-15/19/20 are next best with slightly better detail than Fuji with a tiny more noise.  Sony ties for 3rd with Fuji with slightly less detail and noise (Sony has the most agressive noise reduction of the 4 so there is a little bit more detail smearing.)- Fuji is almost unusable for video.  When you pan the camera the video stutters.  Even worse, when you zoom, camera has MAJOR problems focusing to the point the camera will not focus properly at all most of the time beyond 7X zoom.  The lens motor is also the most audible out of all the 4 cameras.  Panasonics you can barely hear the lens.  Sony wins with Panasonics coming in a close second.- Low-light / High ISO: Fuji comes in second. Sony wins. Panasonics come in third - images are unusable beyond ISO 800, too much yellow color splotching all over.  At ISO 400, it is practically a tie between Panasonic, Fuji, and Sony.  At crazy ISO 1600 and up, Fuji wins with usable images (barely) followed by Sony but you really can't expect much from these small cameras with small sensors at those kind of ISOs.- Flash: Fuji comes in third.  Very strange flash that only pops up manually (which has its benefits).  You must press tiny button on side of camera really hard.  Flash is not motorized and it looks like a part of the camera that could easily break in the future.  Flash is underpowered compared to the other cameras.- Design/Usability/Software - Fuji is heaviest of the 4 cameras but has a nice rubberized feeling body finish.  Panasonic is amazingly small. Sony in-between.  All of them have different styles of software.  Panasonic has best set of software features.  Sony very limited in scene modes.  Fuji has nice software but many of the options are locked out when in any mode other than manual.  Panasonic's wins as far as the Intelligent Auto function. Very reliable.  Canon had troubles focusing sometimes.Overall, Panasonic wins.  Fuji would be a close second, tied with Sony if the video wasn't so terrible.  Search YouTube for videos including this example:[...]

Reviews.Title: A Great Return on Investment
Reviews.Author: jim@rockware.com "Jim Reed"
Reviews.Content: I've taken a zillion exposure-bracketed pictures (for subsequent HDR merging) and videos with this little guy and it's been great.  It's certainly not perfect, but given the price, I have no regrets.  The zoom is outrageously noisy when recording video and the autofocus during zooming is terrible, but I still consider this a great deal and keep it with me at all times.  It's my first Fuji product and I've gained enough trust in their technology to start investigating their higher-end cameras.

Reviews.Title: Continuous shooting confusing and not per manual
Reviews.Author: F-Stop
Reviews.Content: Hi users and reviewers of this camera:The blurb above says, "High Speed Continuous Shooting Capture action at almost 8 fps at full 16-megapixel resolution or shoot at 11 fps at 8-megapixel resolution" and the manual on page 47 describes how to do this ... but I only ever got three pics.  That's hardly continuous.So I called customer support and they confirmed that it does not shoot true continuous, just three separate pics with one shutter press.Can't be true, so I just hit "redial" on the 800 number and this time got somebody who at least cared, and was even knowledgeable.Continuous does work (albeit with limitations,) but nothing like in the manual ... and really klunky and non-intuitive.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Kirkwold
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera. It is replacing one just like it that I had for 3 1/2 years that I wore out. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants an all around camera that works well in low light as well as bright light.

Reviews.Title: pretty good
Reviews.Author: Morris Pearl "citizen of the world"
Reviews.Content: Briefly: The resultant pictures are pretty good.  I use the EXR mode, but I can't really say if the super-duper EXR features deserve credit for the quality or not.  My typical use is doing candid pictures at a party from across the (reasonably well lit) room, and it seems very good for that purpose.  I chose the camera (in part) because of the IS mode to counteract ones hands shaking.  It is more of a factor than with a large camera because this camera is designed to be used while holding it in one hand and looking at the LCD on the back.  I still sometimes get a blurry picture, but it seems work well a lot of the time.  I don't have any way of doing a scientific comparison.Positives: - The camera is so small and light that I can stick it in my pocket and carry it around everywhere.  That is the reason I mostly use this camera.  My Canon Rebel (DSLR) works fine, but I can't shlep it around with me all the time. - Panorama mode works as advertised.  You have to get used to moving the camera evenly and at the right speed so that it finishes at about the same time you get to the end of the panorama, but with a couple of tries I can get it to work.Negatives: - Battery must be removed from the camera and placed into a separate device for charging.  I am concerned that there could eventually be a lot of wear and tear from opening and closing. - The auto focus seems to take a little bit of time, particularly if I'm taking a picture of something off in the distance.  Sometimes I am taking a picture of a street scene from block or two away, and I wish it had a manual focus that I could just crank out.

Reviews.Title: THE ULTIMATE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Pilotjay
Reviews.Content: This camera rocks!!! I used to have a Fuji F700 way back when, but it finally died. This is the closest camera to the F700. When my F700 died, I switched to Nikon, good photos but slow! Happy to have the quick draw of the Fuji F750!!! Takes as good or better photos than my Nikon L120 and it fits in my pocket! I highly recommend this camera! I just hope that it lasts as long or longer than my Fuji F700...

Reviews.Title: Great technology is no good without quality
Reviews.Author: ChuckL
Reviews.Content: Bought this FinePix F750EXR to take on trip to Italy.  It stopped working the first day we used it, which unfortunately was half way through a guided tour of Rome.  The lens stopped retracting and the camera registered a "focus error" message.  Luckily we had my iPhone which actually took some decent shots and we bought a new Nikon the next day (which does an awesome job BTW).  The technology on the Fuji sounded great and we wanted something small and easy to use.  We had a Fuji several years ago that took gorgeous, effortless pictures, but after a couple of years it developed a problem that immediately discharged the battery.  We've learned our lesson.  The most advanced technology in the world can't overcome poor quality.  This camera feels cheap and I can't get over how flimsy the flash assembly is.  I might have returned it anyway.

Reviews.Title: You can have your camera back
Reviews.Author: Lori Krupke "Book Lor"
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I purchased the camera because it was pretty.  That being said, I needed a camera with a good zoom and date stamp.Within a few weeks the lens cover started to stick and my photos had a black spot on the lower right corner.  That self corrected after a few days.  After 3 months of use the lens went bad-- couldn't take any photos at all. I contacted Fuji and since the camera was under warranty they gave me directions to send it in for repair.After they had the camera for a week, they sent me a bill for $200 to replace the lens.  After a lengthy phone conversation with Fuji they fixed the camera under the warranty - which we should not have to beg them to do what they promise to do when we purchase these items to begin with.  I got the unit back 5 days ago with a different lens on it.Drove 112 miles to get my photos for work yesterday and guess what?, yes my lens is malfunctioning again.  Cost me time and money.  I would send it in for repair, but I need to cut my loses now.  They can have it back, but I won't spend the $10.00 to ship it back.  It's too bad, it sure is pretty.

Reviews.Title: Well made, but I think mine was defective.
Reviews.Author: OldPhotoGuy
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these Fuji FinePix F750EXR's for Christmas gifts because of the great price. These originally sold for about $350 and I got them for around $145. Unfortunately, the one I opened up and tried out could not clearly focus to save it's life. 98% of the pics were unacceptable and blurry.  My $75 digital point and shoot camera put it to the shame. I can't believe a camera of this brand, price, and metal build could be so bad, so I'm going to assume that the one we got was defective. I immediately sent the other one back as well, not wanting to take a chance on it after what happened for the first one. This may be a great camera if you get one, I wouldn't know. But this does say something about Fuji's quality conrol.

Reviews.Title: Flash won't stay locked in stored posistion
Reviews.Author: michael myers
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival of camera, the flash was in the use position. It would not lock in the stored position. After being sent to numerous people at the mailing company I was able to get a return authorization email. I was told by one person  I must have broke the flash, and sent me to someone else. By that time they were closed,, I had to wait until the next day to report my damaged camera. The lady I talked to the next day was very understanding and gave me the RMI via email and even expedited the shipping so I can (hopefully get by xmas). I even bought the extended warranty and the first salesman never even acknowledged that fact and I thought I was going to have to pay for the repair. If the company really monitors their phone calls for quality they need to listen to the phone call we had. If I get a replacement camera by xmas I would give the camera and company a 4 or 5 star rating. I tried the camera and the flash worked and the quality of my pictures I took was awesome. and the camera seemed easy to operate. I'll respond more after I get my new camera back.

Reviews.Title: Horrible video cant even use!  Blur on the right side of all photos since day 1
Reviews.Author: A's Mommy
Reviews.Content: Cant use and support not great!I have had issues with my video as well as a blur on the right hand side of photos! The video is touted in the selling points and personally this was the main reason I purchased this camera! Something small that can shoot decent photos and good video. I'm back to using my old and very large Canon SX20IS which is lower quality video but still clear compared to this horrible camera. The video is constantly focusing in and out every second, you can even use it!  When taking pictures I have to leave a space on the right hand side to make up for the blur that takes up the whole right side on photos, this is so inconvenient and for the cost of this camera it should take decent photos and video, of which it does neither. This is a horrible camera. I have contacted Fuji and they want me to send it in of course, I'd prefer an exchange as I bought this at the end of July. Wish I had my money back, the model in the store sure seemed like a winner.. This is not a good buy.!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: David S. Price
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps my fifth Fuji FinePix in a row, and very likely my last.  I was extremely pleased with the first 4..definitely extremely good value cameras with consistently good photos.  This F750EXR is horrible.  The focus is inconsistent, the lighting is often times way too dark or nearly a white-out.  Other than the occasional macro photo of a flower where there is virtually no movement, this camera isn't worthy of having the Fuji name on it.  If this is the direction Fuji is going, then I will never buy another Fuji camera again.

Reviews.Title: terrible Fujifilm FinePix F750EXR Digital Camera (Red)
Reviews.Author: Rooster
Reviews.Content: the Fujifilm FinePix F750EXR Digital Camera (Red)was terrible, especially for how expensive it was!  it's defective.  it doesn't focus fast and not focus well when zoom, esp when moving to one place to another place.  it doesn't allow as many pics taken while videoing.  the zoom get stuck and not turn off camera.  it doesn't fit on the tripod when want to put it on a timer to take pic.  for how expensive it is, it didn't come with a carrying case for the camera.  and it didn't come with 1 memory stick.  it didn't come with more other things that would like for it to come along with.  there's many more problems.  don't have time to write more.  i was very disappointed in it for how expensive it was.  hope some of these problems will discourage people in buying it.  so not have to hassle in buying then have to return it.  luckily, was able to return for a full refund and didn't have to pay for return postage for shipping and handling.  i will not recommend to anyone.  don't like it at all. hopefully, this helps and help the company to improve their item much better for the future consumer.

Reviews.Title: packing
Reviews.Author: charles hyde
Reviews.Content: The manufacture used a strong adhesive tab on the sleeve the camera is packed in and when removing  the camera the adhesivetab is likely to stick on the viewing screen causing a terrible mess that is impossible to remove from the screen without damage.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: SamIam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from vacation with the new camera.  Takes fantastic photos.  Photos taken from a moving boat at 20x zoom are crisp.  Photos taken in dark areas are remarkably clear.Would absolutely recommend this camera.The only draw back: no view finder, but so few cameras have one anymore.Also, the pictures taken on an overcast day came out so well no one will believe the weather we braved on a seaside cliff to get the pictures!

Reviews.Title: A Super Value and Perfect for my use
Reviews.Author: James D. Harris
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and the zoom is smooth as glass, I am a online seller of body jewelry business, creating sharp unedited images.

Reviews.Title: great camera for price
Reviews.Author: Dave86
Reviews.Content: i read lots of reviews on this camera and they claim the sensor size on a camera in this price range is very range at 16mb.  I have used it a lot so far in low light inside and it auto pics iso 1600, the pics are pretty descent but a little grainy.  they claim the best pics are at iso400 or lower.  I think the pics are crips at 1600 but you will need to adjust contrast and reduce noise with noise filter.  I use Noiseware.I would say that overall great camera, nice and portable.  you can easily put in a pocket to carry.Great deal for the price, like everything you just need to get used to how it takes pics.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: This camera met all my expectations! Great quality image, great video. the zoom is really good. Great to travel because it's light to carry around and takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Fuji Film Fine Pix F750EXR Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. P. Power
Reviews.Content: Man I love this Camera, Starting with the Price.. and then I like the easy way it is to set up..and then I saw the Pictures Which are very nice.. I got this camera for a work camera but it is so much more in what it can do.. And I love how easy it is to adjust...  I have never have to pick up a manual fpor this... and It is Fast too No delay in the picture once you click it.  like on some others in its classs like Nikon I hate to say which is slow...  its High quality that you can feel  really in the way its buildt it feels substaintial (spell) or should I say strong.. been using two of these for 5 months for work and I still like them a lot...

Reviews.Title: My cell phone takes better pictures.
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: pictures are always grainy and blurry. Battery life is bad, only 100 to 120 photos and the battery dies. Zoom is nice... if you can hold it still long enough to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: excellentThe product is as shown in the description, I loved it and fulfilled my expectations. I recommend the purchase. It's great.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality for the money
Reviews.Author: C. Whipple
Reviews.Content: Really awesome camera.  Love the features and customization capability for those who don't always want the auto setting on.  The 360 degree pics are sweet.  Camera was a bit larger and heavier than I thought, but that is more than made up for with the lens and features.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA.
Reviews.Author: BIGGUYBOB
Reviews.Content: Camera has lots of options. Takes great pictures. It was shipped quickly and well wrapped for protection. Fits great in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Denise Lester
Reviews.Content: This camera works great. It takes beautiful pictures and is easy to use. Buy it you wont be sorry at all!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Maria Cuinas
Reviews.Content: I have been using Fujifilm ever since I bought my first digital camera, and I am still very happy with their devices. The zoom takes amazing shots in the EXR function, although it has some problems regulating the ISO when there are light and dark areas in the same picture. Video quality is excellent and the zoom works better than in previous FinePix models.It's better to be aware that batteries run out very soon if pictures are taken in the best quality mode (FinePix).

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: I have only used it briefly, but the delivery was fast and the product is what I wanted.  I can't say the same for the warranty.

Reviews.Title: awsome camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jim Reynolds
Reviews.Content: Brought as a point and shoot, chose F750exr because it was in my price range and has more features than I will ever use and auto mode has around 50 different options, makes point and shoot easy, also has a excellent zoom. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: A time-consuming problem with no camera to use!
Reviews.Author: Beverly B. Blair "Turquoise & Indian Jewelry ...
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived from Amazon defective.  The lens would not come out when the camera was turned on.  Amazon would not exchange it for one that worked, therefore I had no choice but to send it to Fujifilm for repair.  I have returned from being away from home  -  would have been nice to have the camera along  -  and the camera had arrived back here.  I haven't re-installed the battery, hand strap, etc. and do not yet know if it now functions properly.  I haven't had a lot of additional time to spend on this purchase, but am ultimately hoping to find that the camera is finally working. If my experience with it is at least satisfactory, naturally my rating will improve.

Reviews.Title: Club photos
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Roberts "Tiffany"
Reviews.Content: Shipping was very prompt! Packaged well. Camera is great. Still trying to figure out all its nuisances. The pop up flash is a little scary for using out at the clubs at night. One drop and that puppy will break off.....
